meanings.sent1: The inharmonies between the two friends led to constant arguments.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonies in the music made it difficult to enjoy the concert.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonies in the team's strategy caused confusion during the game.
meanings.sent4: The inharmonies in their opinions created a rift that was hard to mend.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonies in the colors clashed and created a chaotic painting.

meanings.sent1: The inharmonies in the choir performance were noticeable to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonies of the instruments created a jarring sound.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonies in their voices made the song sound comically off-key.
meanings.sent4: The inharmonies in their arguments echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonies in the conversation made it awkward and tense.

meanings.definition: A lack of compatibility or consistency
meanings.sent1: The inharmonies in their schedules made it hard to plan a meeting.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonies in their tastes made it challenging to agree on a restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonies in their styles clashed in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The inharmonies in their work methods caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonies in their personalities made it hard to work together smoothly.
